compound_nouns.description: Use compound nouns correctly (instead of unnecessary prepositions or possessives)

countable_nouns.description: Use countable nouns correctly (avoiding describing them as units or plurals)

quantify_countable.description: Quantify countable nouns correctly with several, many and few

quantify_uncountable.description: Quantify uncountable nouns correctly with much and little

numbers.description: Use numbers correctly, including large numbers

since_vs_for.description: Use since and for appropriately for unfinished periods with the present perfect tense

comparative_superlative.description: Use the comparative and superlative form correctly

so_vs_such.description: Use so and such for intensification

third_person_s.description: Be consistently accurate with -s endings in 3rd person (he, she it) conjugations in the present simple

past_simple_negative.description: Be consistently accurate with past simple negative sentences

past_simple_questions.description: Be consistently accurate with past simple questions

question_forms.description: Be consistently accurate with question forms

present_perfect.description: Use the present perfect tense to talk about unfinished time (rather than simplifying with present simple or other tenses)

narrative_tenses.description: Tell a complete anecdote using the narrative tenses + present perfect

past_modals_criticism.description: Use past modals for criticism (should and could)

ability_obligation.description: Talk about ability and obligation in the past and future

deduction.pretty_title: Deduction and guessing with might and must
deduction.description: Make deductions and guesses using the past form of might and must

past_future_would.description: Describe the past's future using would

third_conditional.description: Describe imagined alternative scenarios in the past (3rd conditional)

linking_structures.description: Create structured sequences of arguments using a variety of linking words

linking_expansion.description: Expand, exemplify and develop arguments using variety of linking words

linking_contrast.description: Make elegant thematic transitions using contrast or counter-expectation linking words

linking_balance.description: Balance positive and negative points using contrast or counter-expectation linking words

recommendation_reporting.description: Use verbs for recommendation and reporting in a natural way

prepositions_end.description: Place prepositions at the end of questions and relative clauses

cleft_sentences.description: Use cleft sentences as a strategy for clear communication

correlatives.description: Use correlatives to make impactful sentences

inversion.description: Use inversion to make impactful sentences

possessive_pronouns.description: Be consistently accurate with possessive adjectives and pronouns

relative_pronouns.description: Be consistently accurate in the use of relative pronouns

simple_passive.description: Consistent accuracy using the present simple and past simple passive

complex_passive.description: Consistent accuracy using the passive forms of present continuous, present perfect and other tenses or modalities

verb_complements.description: Consistent accuracy in the use of verb complements (with 10+ verbs)

want_structure.description: Use a natural sentence structure with the verb 'want'

look_forward_used_to.pretty_title: Look forward to / be used to
look_forward_used_to.description: Uses the expressions look forward to and be/get used to correctly

possessive_s.description: Use possessive -s when appropriate to avoid overuse of 'of'

echo_questions.description: Use echo questions to show interest or skepticism

tag_questions.description: Use tag questions to signal a willingness to interact
